choices.D: It is granted to the c##admin user in all PDBs and can be granted object and system privileges for a PDB.
choices.C: It is granted to the c##admin user in all PDBs and can be granted only to a local user in a PDB.
choices.B: It is granted to the c##admin user only in the CDB.
choices.A: It is created only in cdb$root and cannot be granted to the c##admin user with the container=all clause.

discussion.content: Yes i agree D, considering CONTAINER =ALL

choices.E: The recovery_catalog_owner role should be granted to the virtual catalog owner.
choices.D: The register database privilege should be granted to the virtual catalog owner.
choices.A: A base recovery catalog should exist.
choices.C: At least one target database should be registered in the recovery catalog.
choices.B: The owner of VPC cannot own recovery catalog.

questions.question_text: Which three conditions must be met before you create a Virtual Private Catalog (VPC)?

discussion.content: The virtual private catalog was introduced in Oracle 11g. This new feature lets you grant restricted access on RMAN Catalog to some users so that they can access a limited set of application databases that are registered in the recovery catalog.

comments.content:
Sorry but you are wrong. A D E are the correct answers based on this link

https://docs.oracle.com/cd/B28359_01/backup.111/b28273/rcmsynta013.htm#RCMRF117

choices.C: Unused blocks below the high-water mark are not backed up.
choices.B: Binary compression creates performance overhead during a backup operation.
choices.E: It works only for locally managed tablespaces.
choices.D: Compressed backups cannot have section size defined during a backup operation
choices.A: Compressed backups can only be written to media.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about compression of backup sets?

choices.A: It can create only local users in all the PDBs.
choices.D: It can create only local users in the CDB.
choices.C: It can create common users only when it is logged in to the CDB.
choices.E: It can be granted only common roles in the PDBs.
choices.B: It has a common schema for all the PDBs.

discussion.content:
B: when in root database =ALL is default 
C: common users can be created only in cdb
I agree for the A C

questions.question_text:
View the SPFILE parameter settings in the Exhibit.
//IMG//

You issue this command and get errors:

SQL> startup -
ORA-00824:cannotsetSGAJTARGET or MEMORY_TARGET due to existing internal settings, see alertlog for more information
Why did the instance fail to start?

choices.C: because memory_target and memory_max_target cannot be equal
choices.D: because sga_target and memory_target are both set
choices.B: because statistics_level is set to basic
